contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=January 2008}} '''Communications in [[Saint Lucia]]''' ==Telephone== '''[[Telephone]]s - main lines in use:''' 90,000 '''Telephones - mobile cellular:''' 100,000 '''Telephone system:''' * ''Domestic:'' System is automatically switched. * ''International:'' Direct microwave radio relay link with [[Martinique]] and [[Saint Vincent and the Grenadines]]; tropospheric scatter to [[Barbados]]; international calls beyond these countries are carried by [[Intelsat]] from [[Martinique]]. Saint Lucia is part of the [[North American Numbering Plan]]; its [[area code]] is '''[[Area code 758|758]]'''. ==Radio== '''[[Radio]] broadcast stations:''' AM 2, FM 7 (plus 3 repeaters), shortwave 0 (1998), includes [[VQH-AM]] 660 '''Radios:''' 111,000 (1997) ==Television== '''[[Television]] broadcast stations:''' 3 (of which two are commercial stations and one is a community antenna television or CATV channel) (1997) '''Televisions:''' 100,000 (2005) ==Internet== {{Expand section|date=June 2008}} Saint Lucia's [[country code top-level domain]] is [[.lc]]. As of 2000, there were 15 [[Internet service provider]]s serving the country. 99.9% of the population has internet {{North America topic|Telecommunications in}} {{Telecommunications}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Telecommunications In Saint Lucia}} [[Category:Telecommunications by country|Saint Lucia]] [[Category:Communications in Saint Lucia| ]] {{Telecommunications-stub}}
